pros: Highly Positive Environment with amazing co-workers. Full body contract which also for employees to sign based though a system of values which revolve around the skills and lessons.
cons: Understandably the environment as times needs to be more strict and discipline based upon the fact that lives are at risk.

review_title: No one is overpaid at the institute
pros: There are some very good and conscientious rank-and-file employees at NMMI.
cons: The tiers of leadership at the director level and above have no competence in organizational leadership whatsoever. As a nominally "military" organization, it is the least regimented place I have worked in 20 years.

job_title: Admissions Student Worker in Roswell, NM
pros: relaxed schedule and flexible with school and corps activities
cons: the amount of money you could make

pros: Generally dedicated, attentive students, lots of extra-curricular.
cons: Weird old-world discipline, a culture of fear mongering, lack of leadership.

pros: Small city, retirement plan, working with the cadets is awesome.
cons: Parents should be prepared to augment instruction in New Mexico’s schools.

pros: Great environment, great team, high moral, higher ups actually care about employees.

job_title: Senior Web Services Developer in Roswell, NM
pros:
It's one of the few local places to work as a programmer.

Lots of diversity in jobs done. 

Management is wonderful. 

Emphasizes proper work life balance.
cons: There are a lot of bureaucratic hoops to jump through to get approval for projects.

review_title: Good benefits but administration is out of touch
pros: NMMI is generally a good place to work. You get good benefits, generous annual and sick leave, free gym use, campus is beautiful, and most people are friendly.  If you're lucky, you'll work for one of the few good directors on campus.
cons: NMMI's biggest problem is an out of touch administration (CEO, CFO, Chief of Staff, and some directors). They refuse to modernize campus resources for cadets, lackluster technology and social media presence, poor resources for parents, no training, no cohesiveness, ridiculous graduation requirements,..just to name a few. Getting a raise is nearly impossible without putting up a year long fight with the CFO who sees everyone as leeches., regardless of how hard they work. Some positions have been incorrectly classified per the Department of Labor, but you will not get back pay! Lack of communication between departments is a huge issue, management is constantly passing the buck. Change is almost impossible or takes 3+ years to achieve.

review_title: nice place at times but they don't value good employees or pay a decent wage
pros:
Great co-workers in some buildings
Hours are nice if you have a child
Most people are very friendly and helpful
cons:
Run by old guys who are slow to take anything new into consideration. 

Pay is probably the lowest I've seen, they also pay each position the same, so if one secretary is lazy and the other works hard consistently they still get the same pay. 
 
Upper management complains about staff turnover, but the staff leaves due to low pay, yet pay hasn't gone up aside from last year to cover the insurance increase. 
They don't care about employees or hard work, it's all politics and who likes who best.

pros: Great work environment. Very rewarding job, working with young adults coaching and mentoring them. Pay and benefits are good too.
cons: Working hours can be a strain the first three weeks of the school year. After that, they become more normal, except you don't get a regular weekend. Most people are off Thursday Friday, or Sunday Monday.

cons: Working at NMMI can be stressful at times.  A lot of changes happen suddenly and without warning so your day can get tossed all about.
